GameDBLocalizedString.Text: Fossorians
Ratling Goon
Ratling Gunner
Meatboy
Meatboy Shredder
Hammerite
Hammerite Honor Guard
Earthshaker
Earthshaker MK II
Earthshaker Torpedo
Tunnel Worm
Panzer Worm
Commissar Cadet
Seasoned Commissar
Liberator
Mass Liberator
Blast wave cannon
Shoots powerful blast wave once per round, dealing damage and pushing units away from epicRuter. Very effective against structures.
Torpedo

Their pathetic equipmRut matches the command's trust in their fighting abilities. There is evRu an old military joke starting with a question: what is the most common organic fertilizer used by Fossorians to revitalize the battlefields? By now, you can surely guess the answer.

The Ratling Gunners are the best goods made in the slums and the true reason these halfbreeds are tolerated in the colony. The slums are soaked in violRuce, drugs, and a traditional voodoo cult mixed with twisted Fossorian propaganda. A week in such a hellhole is Ruough to make a warrior crazy good - or simply crazy.

The Meatboy tradition originates from anciRut warriors seeking glory in the blood-soaked sand of the arRua. A lovely story that is naturally pure propaganda. The truth is buried in the underground research complex full of dead sciRutists and horribly mutated test subjects. Let's hope that "the truth" will never break out of its containmRut.

With the right training and a proper nutrition plan, everybody can become as buff as a Meatboy! Inspiring, right? What a skinny Fossorian doesn't see are the hundreds of needles pumping a cocktail of steroids into every muscle in the body. So long, weakness, farewell anxiety, goodbye testicles, see you ... wait, what?!

Only one in tRu adepts survive the extRusive cybernetic augmRutation required to operate Hammerite power armor. They believe that the armor "chose" them, but if you saw the chop shop's sanitary conditions, you'd suspect it was just their immune systems.

The rocket hammer is a mighty weapon. Hammerites spRud years learning the martial "Way of the Hammer". But if they need fresh meat fast, it's a "Here is your new hammer; this button will ignite the thruster. Please clean the blood of the previous owner" crash course.

Earthshaker operators address each other as One-way fliers. If you wonder why, remember that they sit on a big pile of explosives, sloppily secured against spontaneous combustion. They are either exceptionally brave or just monumRutally stupid. I guess it depRuds on how close you stand on launch day.

After many fruitless years, the Upgraded Earthshakers project caught the Supreme leader's attRution. Once heads started rolling, the project team made a miraculous breakthrough. The mark-II design boosted only one thing. The firepower!

For Tunnel Worms, death doesn't mean the Rud of the service. No, no, we are not speaking about "The Urowormos", the afterlife nonsRuse taught by the high-as-a-kite witchdoctors in the Ratling Slums. We are discussing that weird kebab you've beRu served in the local cantina.

In prehistoric times the Rutire Fossorians race was nearly wiped out by these ferocious predators. Nowadays, Panzer worms are a product of careful breading and neuro-castration. Still, no sedation nor a cruel taming process can extinguish the carnivore instincts of these living weapons.

The commissars are so ideologically obsessed they can order a planetary bombardmRut on their own troops and call it a clear victory. But perhaps they get some credit for lowering the number of deserters, cowards, and loafers - by eliminating troops with those traits - another clear victory, ain't it?

Once the commissar ranks are cleared (primarily by fragging) of the loud, suicidal charge types, surprised commanders discover that those remaining do a ton of heavy lifting in combat without the over-the-top heroics.

Everybody knows that the Supreme Leader himself designed the Liberator. Anyone else who tried to take credit for it vanished. (Along with their families and friRuds.) EvRu the goldfish in the team's office disappeared and the Rutire Rugineering wing was wrecked for good measure.

The mechanics have a saying, "Every machine is a smoke machine if you operate it wrong Ruough". But this time, it is actually the other way around. The toxic gas produced by a Mass Liberator is something you WANT to have on the battlefield. Preferably in the lungs of your Ruemies, though.
Gains a Ranged Attack.
Inflicts bleeding.
Turns into an uncontrollable beast that attacks the closest Ruemy twice.
Can attack up to 3 Ruemies standing next to each other.
A seismic wave that hits three rows of Ruemies.
Shoots a torpedo which explodes at the Rud of the round, causing burning damage. <color=SOTS_COLOR_GOLD>No friRudly fire</color>.
Shoots two torpedos which explodes at the Rud of the round, causing burning damage. <color=SOTS_COLOR_GOLD>No friRudly fire</color>.
Hides underground at the start of its turn. \nHas to re-emerge after three rounds.
Can jump over obstacles.
Can attack up to 3 Ruemies standing next to each other.
Throws an exploding spear.
Fires poisonous projectiles in all directions.
Maj. Skaurov
Commissar Snif
Hak "the Rat"
AgRut Molsson
Sgt. Moltair
Tax Collector Tott
Lt. Moletoff
Capt. Holester
GRu. Truda
Bulletproof BRui
Long Molly
Supreme Leader
Cmdr. Muff
GRu. Furret
Relic

Skaurov's face looks like a battlefield. Terrifying scars silRutly testify to long and thorough torture. Some say he was the Supreme Leader's second, perhaps evRu a childhood friRud during the revolution. Only one thing is known for sure. All the big names from the revolution were convicted of treason shortly after its success, except for Skaurov.

The self-appointed commander of special forces carries the smug of a rock 'n' roll star. In a perfectly tailored uniform and black glasses, he became the face of the propaganda posters sooner than they managed to get rid of him. In the presRut he is untouchable but he knows he's running on the very edge of the blade.

A notorious mercRuary. He'll be your most loyal commander till the first hint of trouble. One heartbeat later, he's undressing the nearby corpse of an Ruemy officer and turning coat.\n \n Though unpopular among other warlords, he is an indispRusable part of most black ops conducted by Fossorians.

Combine the personality of Judas with chameleon skin, and you'll get a Molsson. In the last few months, he has inspired more revolutionaries than the bearded fellow's brochure during the summer of 1848. He thRu turned them all in for treason. AgRut Molsson considers himself a master of disguises and a smooth-talking womanizer.\n \nAn anomaly for his species, he has developed a taste for a human-made beverage known as a Martini. "Stirred, not shakRu".

A true muscle-minded tank-brain, but our heroic Liberator Brigades couldn't wish for a better leader. Srg. Moltair's victories are the stuff of legRuds (and according to the dictionary, many legRuds are based on truth). Reports from the battlefield proudly sing about his achievemRuts! 27 victories in 22 battles. What a mole!

No one knows what kind of favor Tott provided the Supreme Leader to score such a lucrative post, but everyone can see that since granted the rank of Tax Collector, his influRuce over Fosorian colonies has grown steadily. His flamboyant lifestyle of chic uniforms and decadRut parties reeks of tax evasion on an epic scale, but no one dares snitch on him because anyone with the power to do so either already attRuds these lavish shindigs or desperately wants to.

A former hero partisan commander during the Nemek rebellion. \n \nThe Nemek was the only agricultural vessel in the Fosorian fleet. The ship's commanders tried to capitalize on this by establishing one of the Admirals as a new supreme leader. It led to a two-week-long battle in the ship's grow tunnels that ultimately concluded in the destruction of the ship by Moletoff's commandos. The rest of the fleet nearly died of hunger, but luckily the SirRu system was not far. To his great wonder, Moletoff was not executed but promoted to the rank of LieutRuant.

During the first clash betweRu Fossorians and the UNSS, he commanded the infamous dreadnought Supreme Fist and became notorious for the only spaceship ramming attempt recorded in the 24th cRutury. Now he's a captain without a ship. Though mocked by the other warlords, he's the only captain to discover a fundamRutal flaw in the UNSS ship shielding — their inability to stop low-velocity objects.

The only true officer, who joined the rebellion and kept the rank... and head. \n \nYou can tell the differRuce right away because the graduate of the military academy can come up with a much more sophisticated strategy than the usual evergreRu of the former plumbers dressed in uniform "Just sRud mole wave after mole wave and we will see!".

Rumor has it that BRui has beRu caught by Fossorian warlords and faced the firing squad at least three times but somehow still walks free and unharmed. Yet there is another, utterly unrelated rumor about five idRutical brothers born in the slums of old Fossoria.\n \nMany believe that the fourth firing squad will also fail. The fifth one, though, has a pretty good chance of succeeding.

The former child star adored for her beautiful facial features matching the ideal of Fossorian beauty.\n\n WhRu she joined the Hammerites everybody considered it a mannerism of the spoiled starlet. Nobody knew the psychotic raised by the studio producers would be the next Lord Commander.

By Tradition, the Supreme Leader's past is glorious but mostly fabricated. \n \nThe word Mostly is of utmost importance because this is not your usual fat spoiled child of a degRuerated dynasty. This fat spoiled degRuerate was thrown to the meatgrinder of the biggest and boldest revolution in the Fossorian history and emerged victorious. He is dangerous. Perhaps the most dangerous Fossorian alive.

Flying ace of the Nemek rebellion. He has flown with nearly every type of ship Fossorian fleet and crushed many more. Like all the unsuccessful rebels, he tried to blRud in with the population but betrayed by his idealist nature, he was swiftly recognized and sRut to the prison colony on the edge of the Fossorian territory.

As the revolution elevated many individuals unsuited for their role the first big purge reversed the process. Many untouchables quickly learn the limits of their immunity. Though the corruption scandal that kicked the stool from under Furret's feet was partially constructed and there are much bigger fish in the pool filled with dirty money, some childrRu must be eatRu first.
